definition: to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: It would be a complete mistake to decry love of power altogether as a motive.
sentences.chinese: 反对对权力的迷恋是人们的动机之一是个彻底的错误。

sentences.english: Still, I remained enamored of religion itself as an institution.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，我仍然将宗教看作一种习俗来迷恋。

sentences.english: Dick fell for baseball when he was a little boy.
sentences.chinese: 当迪克还是个小孩时，他就迷恋上了棒球运动。

sentences.english: Unable to control themselves, some teenagers get hooked by online games.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏自控能力，一些青少年迷恋于网上游戏。

sentences.english: Do't be obsessed brother, Please obsession Shigemoto mold industry.
sentences.chinese: 不要迷恋哥，请迷恋茂源模业。

sentences.english: Do't be obsessed brother, Please obsession Shigemoto mold industry.
sentences.chinese: 不要迷恋哥，请迷恋茂源模业。

sentences.english: Look, sexual chemistry with other people is normal, and feeling guilty about a crush is an exercise in futility.
sentences.chinese: 暗地的迷恋添入活跃感觉对现在两人是有益处的。

sentences.english: Still remember the days when you are infatuated with mirage?
sentences.chinese: 可还记得那迷恋镜花水月的日子吗？

sentences.english: What does Horsey think of the Democrats' fascination with Clinton?
sentences.chinese: 霍尔西是如何看待民主党人对克林顿的迷恋呢？

sentences.english: Infatuation and worship to money led people's servility to an extreme degree.
sentences.chinese: 对金钱的迷恋和崇拜使人类的奴性地位达到了极端。

sentences.english: We have made a fetish of fevered action.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经形成了一种对狂热行为的迷恋。

sentences.english: Why should I be so painfully obsessed with you?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我要如此痛苦地迷恋着你呢？

sentences.english: So clear and deep are my fancies, of things I wish were true.
sentences.chinese: 那如此清淅且深刻的迷恋，真希望能够美梦成真。

sentences.english: Mr Wang Delin was obsessed with calligraphy from he began studying in Xi'an institute of geological.
sentences.chinese: 王德林先生早在西安地质学院求学时就迷恋上了书法。

sentences.english: Or, put perhaps better, the way to non-attachment is one of encounter not avoidance.
sentences.chinese: 或者，更好的说，不迷恋是不遭遇失望的一种方法。

sentences.english: You're infatuated with her now, but the scales will soon fall form your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 你现在还迷恋着她，但不久就会猛然醒悟过来的。

definition: to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to become excited with/to be enchanted by
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
to treasure/to be very fond of
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to yearn for/to look forward to
to have a special fondness (for sth)
